meanings.definition: To cause to feel self-conscious or ashamed.
meanings.sent1: When I tripped in front of everyone, it really embars me.
meanings.sent2: She embars easily when she has to speak in public.
meanings.sent3: His face turned red, which embars him even more.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected question embars her like a spotlight on stage.
meanings.sent5: The embarrassing moment will forever embars him in his memory.

meanings.definition: To hinder or impede the progress or movement of someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The fallen tree embars the path through the forest.
meanings.sent2: Heavy traffic can embars commuters on their way to work.
meanings.sent3: The road construction embars the flow of traffic in the city.
meanings.sent4: The locked gate embars the escape of the curious dog.
meanings.sent5: A sudden downpour can embars outdoor activities unexpectedly.
